title: Big-O, Big-Ω, Big-Θ Notations
subject: Data Structures
theory:
Asymptotic notations describe limiting behavior.
- **Big-O (O)**: Upper bound (Worst case). Guarantees it won't be worse than this.
- **Big-Omega (Ω)**: Lower bound (Best case).
- **Big-Theta (Θ)**: Tight bound (Average case).

examples.explanation: Best case: Item is first. Worst case: Item is last.

common_mistakes.mistake: Thinking O(n) is always slower than O(1)
common_mistakes.correction: For very small n, O(n) might be faster due to constants. But as n -> infinity, O(1) wins.

interview_questions.question: Why do we prioritize Big-O?
interview_questions.answer: We usually care about the Worst Case scenario to provide performance guarantees.

summary: Big-O provides the standard language for discussing algorithm performance.
